cbt.title: Thought Record Worksheet
cbt.description: Track and challenge negative thoughts using CBT techniques
steps: Identify the situation that triggered your thoughts
Write down your automatic thoughts
Rate your emotions (0-10 scale)
Identify cognitive distortions
Challenge your thoughts with evidence
Create balanced thoughts
Rate your emotions again

cbt.title: Behavioral Activation
cbt.description: Increase positive activities to improve mood
steps: List activities you used to enjoy
Rate each activity for pleasure and mastery
Schedule at least one pleasurable activity daily
Start with small, manageable activities
Track your mood before and after activities
Gradually increase activity level

dbt.title: TIPP Technique
dbt.description: Quick distress tolerance skills for crisis moments
steps: Temperature: Hold ice cubes or splash cold water on face
Intense exercise: Do jumping jacks or run in place
Paced breathing: Slow down your breathing
Paired muscle relaxation: Tense and release muscle groups

dbt.title: Emotion Regulation Check
steps: Identify the emotion you're feeling
Rate the intensity (0-10)
Identify what triggered the emotion
Use opposite action if the emotion doesn't fit the facts
Practice mindfulness of the emotion
Use coping strategies if needed

mbsr.title: Mindful Eating Exercise
steps: Choose a small piece of food (raisin, chocolate)
Look at it carefully - notice color, texture, shape
Smell the food - what aromas do you notice?
Place it in your mouth without chewing
Notice the taste and texture
Chew slowly and mindfully
Notice how the taste changes
Swallow mindfully

mbsr.title: Walking Meditation
steps: Find a quiet place to walk
Stand still and notice your body
Begin walking slowly
Focus on the sensation of your feet touching the ground
Notice the shifting of weight from foot to foot
If your mind wanders, return to your feet
Walk for 10-15 minutes
End by standing still and noticing your body
